Subject: English
QuestionText: What is the main idea of a story? Explain in one or two sentences.
Description: State the main idea in your own words.

Subject: English
QuestionText: Who is the main character in the story? Describe them briefly.

Subject: English
QuestionText: What happened at the beginning of the story?
Description: Retell the beginning in your own words.

Subject: English
QuestionText: What is your favorite part of the story? Why?
Description: Give a reason in one or two sentences.

Subject: English
QuestionText: What does the word big mean? Use it in a sentence.

Subject: English
QuestionText: How are these two characters the same? How are they different?
Description: Compare and contrast in a few sentences.

Subject: English
QuestionText: What do you think will happen next in the story? Why?

Subject: English
QuestionText: What is the setting of the story? Where and when does it take place?

Subject: English
QuestionText: Why did the character do that? Explain in one sentence.
Description: Give a reason from the story.

Subject: English
QuestionText: What is the problem in the story? What is the solution?

Subject: English
QuestionText: What is the central message of this story? Explain in two sentences.

QuestionText: How does the author show that the character is brave? Give examples.

QuestionText: What is the difference between fact and opinion? Give one example of each.

QuestionText: Describe the beginning middle and end of the story in one sentence each.

QuestionText: What does the word enormous mean? How did you figure it out?

QuestionText: What would you do if you were this character? Explain why.

QuestionText: What is the theme of this story? Use evidence from the text to support your answer.

QuestionText: How does the author help you understand the story? Give two examples from the text.
